html:
Oppo's Reno13 and Reno13 Pro went official in China last month, and now it seems like their international launch is imminent. That's because they are in the process of receiving various certifications left and right.

The Reno13 has been certified by Taiwan's NCC, India's BIS, Thailand's NBTC, as well as the FCC. So it's pretty clear that it will be available across the world.

The certifications for the international model reveal a 5,600 mAh battery with support for 80W wired charging, unsurprising since that's the same as what the Chinese model has. It's also got two cameras on the rear, and runs ColorOS 15 based on Android 15.

Connectivity-wise, the certifications confirm dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, GPS, and GNSS. There are no other details but so far it looks like the international Reno13 might be identical to the Chinese one, and that's rarely a given. We'll let you know when we find out more.

Via
